sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At the annual Victory Day parade in Moscow, President Vladimir Putin claimed the West has unleashed what he called a real war on Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In his speech at Russia's annual Victory Day parade, President Vladimir Putin has tried to portray his country as the victim of the West after his illegal invasion of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: At a scaled-down version of the ceremony, he referenced the 14-month-old conflict and attempted to draw parallels with historical events, promising victory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today, civilization is once again on a decisive, turning point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A real war is being waged against our Motherland once again. Против нашей Родины вновь развязана настоящая война.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Мы дали отпор международному терроризму, защитим и жителей Донбасса, обеспечим свою безопасность.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Россия ввел Украину в февраль 24-22, заявляя, что это был специальный военный операционный процесс, чтобы предотвратить украинскую атаку против донбассских сепаратистов. operation to prevent a Ukrainian offensive against Donbass separatists. Later Moscow insisted it's more of a global conflict with NATO and the collective West. The United Nations has so far confirmed over 8,700 civilian deaths in the conflict, while the actual figure is expected to be considerably higher. EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Kyiv and more steps on the road to Ukraine's

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: dream of EU membership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It's a road that's been bumpy of late with Ukraine's grain exports perceived as a threat by some European farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: And from Ukraine's perspective, progress in the process of joining has been painfully slow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It is time for a positive decision on the opening of negotiations about the membership of Ukraine in the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: As we stand here today in a country senselessly attacked, some might think it is impossible, improbable or too distant to talk about a free and peaceful Ukraine in the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But Europe is about making the impossible possible. And so is Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But to make the possibility a reality, Ukraine must first complete seven steps towards accession.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: PMC Wagner chief Yevgeny Prigozhin has again attacked Russia's military commanders,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: blaming them for failing to provide the ammunition he says is needed to fight for Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Prigozhin says the army fled crucial positions in the Bakhmut area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: «This morning, the General Staff personally corrected all the figures and reduced them by 10 times.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is very bad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If this continues, we will not be able to fight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If you do everything to deceive the Commander-in-Chief, either the Commander-in-Chief will rip your ass off, or the Russian people, who will be very upset if the war is lost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Commander-in-Chief he is referring to is Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Russian President has become increasingly reliant on Prigozhin, who's frequently called for more ammunition and accused the Russian army of sabotaging his mercenaries' attempts to deliver a victory in Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: All but two of 25 cruise missiles fired by Russia against Ukraine

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: overnight on Tuesday were intercepted by the country's air defense as the Ukrainian Air Force said in a statement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian military warned earlier this week that Russia is trying to wear down Ukraine's air defenses ahead of an anticipated counteroffensive. Russian forces have made marginal advances within Bakhmut as of the 8th of May.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It reports of intensified Wagner group forces offensive operations. Russian sources claim that Wagner fighters intensified assaults on Ukrainian positions in western Bakhmut and shelling of the area. Now, Ukrainian military officials reported that additional Wagner personnel arrived and are operating in the city, leading to an increased intensity of the assaults.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians have not observed any indications that Wagner intends to leave the city and that intensified shelling likely indicates that Wagner has received more ammunition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Institute for the Study of War says Wagner group leader Evgeny Prigozhin and Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov may have compelled the Russian theatre commander in Ukraine to resume artillery ammunition distribution to the Wagner forces in Bakhmut, despite his desired deprioritization of that effort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, the Russian Ministry of Defense likely has not fundamentally changed its intention of deprioritizing offensive operations and conserving munitions across the theater theater as the Institute for the Study of War recently assessed. Russian occupation authorities are evacuating from some settlements in Kherson region to areas deep in the rear of occupied Zaporizhia region. The Ukrainian general staff reported on the 8th of May that Russian occupation authorities suspended the Skadovsk area and Skadovsk city administrations and loaded documents, office equipment and other state property for transport out of this area.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Pakistan, officials from the party of the former Prime Minister Imran Khan say he was arrested on Tuesday as he appeared at a court in the capital Islamabad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: arrested on Tuesday as he appeared at a court in the capital Islamabad. A senior member of the Pakistan Tariq-e-Insaf party said 72-year-old Khan was detained by agents from the country's anti-corruption body, the National Accountability Bureau, who he said dragged Khan out of the court and into a police vehicle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He described the arrest as an abduction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Khan was ousted in a no-confidence vote in April last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He's claimed the process was illegal and a Western conspiracy and has campaigned against the government of his successor, Prime Minister Shabazz Sharif, demanding early elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He faces multiple charges of corruption but still commands widespread support in Pakistan, which has led to clashes between his supporters and the country's security forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As fighting between rival military factions rages on, the UN says the number of people displaced in Sudan has doubled in a week week from 340 to 700,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The number of people internally displaced in Sudan has more than doubled in the last week according to data that's been collected by the international organization for migration's displacement tracking matrix. Now more than 700,000 people are now internally displaced by the fighting, which began on the 15th of April, according to this latest data.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: More than 150,000 people have left the country since the conflict began on the 15th of April.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At the same briefing, the World Health Organization says 604 people have been killed and more than 5,000 injured since violence erupted.

sentences.sentence: Police officers in Serbia are being deployed to all 1,800 schools in the country

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: as pupils return to regular classes after last week's mass shootings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: More than 2,000 officers are being assigned to patrol in and around school buildings. President Aleksandar Vucic has also demanded a 90% reduction of firearms in circulation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Israeli military said it struck Islamic Jihad targets in the Gaza Strip early on Tuesday, claiming three militant commanders and members of their families were killed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Palestinian Health Ministry said at least nine people died, including a number of children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Local media reports the strikes hit the residences of senior members of the group in the southern city of Rafah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Islamic Jihad, which is smaller than the dominant ruling Hamas movement, confirmed that three of the group's commanders were among the dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The latest attacks come as tension boils between Israel and militants in Gaza.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Israel has been conducting almost daily raids to detain Palestinians suspected of carrying out attacks on Israelis in increasing violence in the occupied West Bank.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In anticipation of rocket attacks in response, the Israeli military told residents within 40 kilometres of Gaza to stay close to bomb shelters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Scandals, ideological lurches, suspicions of cronyism. The image of the Greens as a

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: synonym for coherence and honesty in the German political landscape is crumbling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Robert Habeck, the Minister for Economic Affairs, has been hit by accusations of nepotism against his number two, State Secretary Patrick Grecian, who gave a well-paid post to a close friend.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Amid criticism from the opposition, Habeck and Grecian acknowledged that there was an error of form but not of substance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In a tweet the conservative opposition leader said official client ISM and nepotism may be corrected but the damage to our country will not be repaired so quickly. The opposition's also attacked legislation passed by the government to ban individual gas and oil heating in new construction. In a statement that betrays his doubts the Minister of Economics has indicated that it's likely to come into force later than originally planned.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Many Germans are also angry about the fulfilment of an historic promise, the shutdown of nuclear power plants. In a context of energy shortages linked to the war in Ukraine, many politicians and citizens would prefer to prolong the power station's lives.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A few months ago the government gave the green light to the controversial exploitation of the Lutserrat coal mine in a gesture that did not please their ideological bases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The polls revealed that if elections were held today, the Greens would have about 16 percent of the votes and concede their third position to the far-right AFD.
